result.execSummary:
The defendant Lydell L Nichols was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs.  The court ordered all financial obligations be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervison.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration  Program and the Substance Abuse Program after serving two and a half years (2 1/2) of this sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain/maintain full time employment or fulltime school and part time employment.
Obtain mental health assessment, and if necessary successfully complete follow up treatment.  Take any prescription medication only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treating physician.

No drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users/dealers or drug houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victims Kristina R., Katherine G., Kristine B., and Marine Bank located at 333 N. 35 Street, Milwaukee.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in cognitive thinking program.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain AODA assessment. Successfully complete follow up treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lydell L Nichols

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed on February 6, 2017; Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.    Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, calendar successor, for review. mag

Decision And Order Denying Petition To Amend Judgment Of Conviction  - Judge Brash intended for the defendant to serve at least two and a half years of confinement before qualifying for the early release program.  The court declines to alter that determination, despite the defendant's positive adjustment in the prison system; to do so would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense and frustrate the express intent of the sentencing judge.  Therefore, it is hereby ordered that the defendant's petition to amend the judgment of conviction is denied - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to parties.
Clerk:  jms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se petition to amend JOC.
Original Transcript (50 pages) commencing PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING 09/04/2014 received and filed.

Defendant Lydell L Nichols in court with attorney Scott P. Phillips.  Defendant Lydell L Nichols in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea and Sentencing.  Both counsel timely and prepared to proceed.  Due to the court's congested calendar (unexpected lengthy hearing) this case is unable to be heard on today as defense attorney is due in another court very shortly.  New date selected with the parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Scott P Phillips in court, defendant Lydell L Nichols not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea and Sentencing.  Parties request adjournment as the court's calendar is congested on today.  New date selected with the parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
All conditions of bail previously established to remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Cash bail amended to $3,000.

Defendant Lydell L Nichols in court with attorney Scott P Phillips.  Defendant Lydell L Nichols in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for plea/sentencing hearing.  State requestss additional time to prepare discovery and offer. No objection from defense.   Court ordered case adjourned for plea/sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Scott P Phillips in court, defendant Lydell L Nichols not in court, in custody.  Benjamin A Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
CASE HEARD WITHOUT CIRCUIT COURT FILE.  Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations. Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Scott P. Phillips in court, defendant Lydell L Nichols not in court, in custody.  Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Attorney Scott P. Phillips in court, defendant Lydell L Nichols not in court, in custody.  Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defense awaiting discovery materials.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lydell L Nichols in court with attorney Scott P. Phillips.  Defendant Lydell L Nichols in custody.  Megan Carmody for Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kristina R.; Katherine G.; Kristine B or Marine Credit Union

Defendant Lydell L Nichols in court with Student Intern Zachariah Fudge under the supervision of attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Lydell L Nichols in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
